column4: is it better to have the SWAP partition at the front of my drive, rather than behind the main partition?
with a fast modern drive it doesn't matter much
did you say something or is my client broken?
I changed my background colour and your posts disappeared ;-)
I think the old idea was that putting swap at the beginning of the drive was a good move
that's what i have read; wanted more insight on the idea.
something to do with angular velocity I seem to recall
I guess the beginning of the drive tends to be close to the outer edge of the disk on old disks
i was under the impression that it was faster, because of less space for the heads to travel
hmm - not sure really to be quite honest
a little of topic...can you recommend a decent terminal emulator, thats light on resources?
yes, urxvt from the rxvt-unicode package
or aterm - but aterm doesn't do utf8
